title: frei.sein
author: frei.sein
content: Hi,I want to convert to my crptos to PHP cash, but I dont know how. Before I i met with friends and we do cash transaction, but they all left the country.Does anybody know what I can do? I dont want to install any other app, like co....ph.I have Binance wallet and have bank account, but I am afraid to that I receive black money.Any Idea how to work safe with binance or do cash transaction?

comments.author: malcovi2
comments.body: try using binance p2p since you dont want to install other apps.

comments.author: frei.sein
comments.body: Quote from: malcovi2 on October 26, 2022, 08:36:55 AMtry using binance p2p since you dont want to install other apps.I have Binance, and my account is linked. But how do I assure the money comes from the seller and not from a third party?

comments.author: frei.sein
comments.body: Binance is complete crap! I cant even login(I use copy paste for the password). Resetting the password is also not possible, because system is busy.When I try again to reset the password I cant even press the next button.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: Quote from: frei.sein on October 26, 2022, 10:53:26 AMBinance is complete crap! I cant even login(I use copy paste for the password). Resetting the password is also not possible, because system is busy.When I try again to reset the password I cant even press the next button.Did you type the password manually? Try to type it manually and see if it's going to work. Quote from: frei.sein on October 26, 2022, 10:25:05 AMBut how do I assure the money comes from the seller and not from a third party?It's a P2P so basically, the seller will have the fund transferred to you. As long as the transaction will go through and you receive the fund, it's not a matter of concern whether they use a third party or not.

comments.author: Jemzx00
comments.body: Quote from: frei.sein on October 26, 2022, 10:53:26 AMBinance is complete crap! I cant even login(I use copy paste for the password). Resetting the password is also not possible, because system is busy.When I try again to reset the password I cant even press the next button.Hindi ko sure bakit kung ano yung problema sa account mo, pero nung ni-try ko mag-reset password now, wala naman issue. Are you sure na tama yung ginagawa mo sa pagreset ng password?Quote from: frei.sein on October 26, 2022, 10:25:05 AMBut how do I assure the money comes from the seller and not from a third party?Yung Binance P2P ay person to person trading ng crypto like buy and sell so yung funds or cash na makukuha sa pagbebenta ng crypto ay manggagaling sa ibang tao at hindi mismo sa binance. Quote from: frei.sein on October 26, 2022, 07:49:32 AMAny Idea how to work safe with binance or do cash transaction?For safety reasons naman, try mo makipagtransact sa mga users na maraming trade history para ma-sure mo na hindi ka ma-scam. If any case naman, na concern ka sa "black money" or possible ma-involve sa mga kung ano-ano, pwede mo naman maipakita yung transaction history sa binance as proof na rin.  Hindi ako komportable mag-pure english sa Pilipinas board since pinoy naman tayo dito?

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: frei.sein on October 26, 2022, 07:49:32 AMor do cash transaction?Honestly, there's no safe way for exchanging crypto in person, but there are a few preventive steps that'll reduce its risks to a minimum:If the wallet that you're using allows you to create a hidden wallet, do it and transfer an insignificant amount to your decoy wallet!Make sure to "at least" bring a friend [preferably someone that's tougher than you] and meet in public places that have enough crowd!Try to meet in a place that has a nearby pawnshop or money exchange, so you can take out a few banknotes at random and ask them to check if it's real or counterfeit money [do this before you send your crypto].When everything is done, make sure nobody follows you on your way back home!Quote from: Jemzx00 on October 26, 2022, 01:56:28 PMHindi ako komportable mag-pure english sa Pilipinas board since pinoy naman tayo dito?Sa tingin ko foreigner siya

comments.author: lionheart78
comments.body: Quote from: frei.sein on October 26, 2022, 10:53:26 AMBinance is complete crap! I cant even login(I use copy paste for the password). If you are having problem with Binance, then you can try Huobi p2p.  It works like Binance p2p. Quote from: frei.sein on October 26, 2022, 10:53:26 AMResetting the password is also not possible, because system is busy.When I try again to reset the password I cant even press the next button.It is possible that there is problem with your connection.  You can check your connection via  CMD (dos shell) through ping command if you are in desktop. Sometimes the icon link is unresponsive if you are having a connection problem.

comments.author: Johnyz
comments.body: Why is there a need to convert your crypto into PESO?I believe you’re not PINOY based on your post history and if you are looking for a services to get someone’s information well that’s an old strategy of a scammer. Not to judge here but it’s better to be safe. I just want to remind everyone here to stay cautious and avoid dealing sa mga ganitong services, most probably makikisuyo sila to transact and use your bank or even your gcash, marame na nabiktima ng ganito sa pagkakatanda ko, kaya magingat tayo.

comments.author: crzy
comments.body: There are cashout services available in some areas but I think it’s only available to PINOY. The best way to deal with this is by P2P, and just use your Philippines bank to receive the peso amount.Quote from: Johnyz on November 03, 2022, 09:39:16 PMI just want to remind everyone here to stay cautious and avoid dealing sa mga ganitong services, most probably makikisuyo sila to transact and use your bank or even your gcash, marame na nabiktima ng ganito sa pagkakatanda ko, kaya magingat tayo. Kung totoo man ito, dapat talaga tayo magingat kase nakakapagtaka na mag cashout in peso ang foreigner. Well, tignan naten kung ano ang response nya dito.

comments.author: Baofeng
comments.body: Quote from: crzy on November 03, 2022, 09:58:04 PMThere are cashout services available in some areas but I think it’s only available to PINOY. The best way to deal with this is by P2P, and just use your Philippines bank to receive the peso amount.Quote from: Johnyz on November 03, 2022, 09:39:16 PMI just want to remind everyone here to stay cautious and avoid dealing sa mga ganitong services, most probably makikisuyo sila to transact and use your bank or even your gcash, marame na nabiktima ng ganito sa pagkakatanda ko, kaya magingat tayo. Kung totoo man ito, dapat talaga tayo magingat kase nakakapagtaka na mag cashout in peso ang foreigner. Well, tignan naten kung ano ang response nya dito. Foreigner nga ni check ko ang posting history nya. Tingin ko baka nandito sa Pinas yan baka nag bakasyon o baka may pinuntahan dito at kailangan ng Peso para syempre gamitin dito.Eh mukhang hindi na sumagot eh, baka nakakuha na ng Peso dahil sa mga advise nyo sa taas. Binance at Bybit ang ginagamit ko ngayon, Huobi hindi pa pero masubukan nga kung maganda rin.
